User Query: Explain the role of Dark One and the God in this story
AI Response: In this story, the Dark One (Shai’tan) is the source of evil, the antithesis of the Creator. He was imprisoned at Shayol Ghul at the moment of Creation. His release triggers catastrophic events — the War of the Shadow, tainting of saidin, Breaking of the World, and end of the Age of Legends. The Creator, though not directly described as a “god,” is portrayed as the force who imprisoned the Dark One and created the world. The Dark One is feared and avoided — naming him invites disaster. He is also bound with the Forsaken, thirteen powerful beings sealed in Shayol Ghul with him. The Dark One’s influence spreads through the Shadow, corrupting the world and driving conflict. The Creator’s power is seen as protective, shielding the Light from the Shadow. The story centers on the struggle between these two forces — the Light, represented by the Creator’s creation and the Aes Sedai, versus the Shadow, embodied by the Dark One and his followers. The Wheel turns, and the fate of the world hinges on this eternal battle.
